replies.bodyText:
@gunnarmorling - I assume "these two" apply to oracle.adoc and db2.adoc.
The documentation for the different connectors is inconsistent in its structure: some named the anchor with the prefix (mongodb, sqlserver), some didn't (oracle, db2, cassandra).
What I did here: fix the broken anchors by pointing to the most appropriate existing anchor ID. What I didn't do: restructure/rename anchor IDs.
From an AsciiDoc perspective IDs need to be unique within a document. For Antora each page is a document. If you combine the documentation in a different way (maybe the downstream product?) to a big document, then it might be handy to have unique IDs across all the AsciiDoc files.
replies.author: ahus1

replies.bodyText:
I assume "these two" apply to oracle.adoc and db2.adoc.

Yes, exactly.

What I did here: fix the broken anchors by pointing to the most appropriate existing anchor ID. What I didn't do: restructure/rename anchor IDs.

Ok, gotcha. Thanks for clarifying. So uniqueness within each connector documentation should be enough, we don't create one large document with all the documentation at once. Indeed I think the slight inconsistency originates from downstream work, as the docs team has added the prefix to those files which feed into the downstream product.
I.e. all good, thanks a lot again!
replies.author: gunnarmorling
